title: Drawing, Lifeboat with Carriage (Study for "The Wreck," oil painting dated 1896, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA), 1895–96 [or possibly 1881]
title_raw: Lifeboat with Carriage (Study for "The Wreck," oil painting dated 1896, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA)
medium: Graphite, with pen and black ink and brown ink on green buff paper. discolored to brown
markings: Stamped upside-down in faded ink, at lower right corner: "Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union."
inscribed: Verso: Inscribed in ink, at top center: Which; and again in graphite: (211).
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Horizontal view of four coastguardsmen pulling, and one pushing a lifeboat along wet sand. Lifeboat resting on carriage wheels; star painted on visible end of boat. Turbulent waves indicated at right edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Lifeboat with Carriage (Study for "The Wreck," oil painting dated 1896, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA), 1895–96 [or possibly 1881]. Graphite, with pen and black ink and brown ink on green buff paper. discolored to brown. 
Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-211.
